lines.content: * The Duke class is the main program responsible for instantiating all required classes
* Creates a new Duke object and runs the main method.
* Parser class for CS2103T iP. Handles the logic of the program.
* @param list TaskList object for data manipulation.
ui.printErr("No task was input to be marked as done.");
ui.printErr("No task has been stored at that index yet.");
ui.printErr("No task was input to be deleted.");
ui.printErr("No task has been stored at that index yet.");
ui.printErr("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
ui.printErr("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
ui.printErr("The description or date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
ui.printErr("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
ui.printErr("The description or date of an event cannot be empty.");
ui.printErr("The search query cannot be empty.");
ui.printErr("The search query cannot be empty.");
ui.print("Looks like no tasks were found :(");
output[0] = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";
ui.print("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* IO handler for CS2103T iP. Manages import of saved tasks upon program start and export
* Creates a Storage object for data manipulation.
* @param tasks TaskList to be written into when importing saved tasks.
* @param ui Any messages generated will be directed to the provided Ui object.
ui.print("It appears you are using Duke for the first time. Welcome!");
* @throws FileNotFoundException When file is not found.
ui.print("Looks like you have no tasks! :)");
ui.print("Tasks saved from last session imported! :)");
* @throws IOException When there are IO errors.
* Task object for CS2103T iP. Stores relevant data regarding a task, including type, task,
* date and time (if required) and whether it has been completed.
* @param type Type of task: 0 is todo, 1 is deadline, 2 is event
* When called on a task, marks the task as done.
* Checks for whether the task is done. Used as part of the toString() method.
* Checks for the task type. Used as part of the toString() method.
* @return T for todo, D for deadline and E for event.
* A readable format of the Task.
* @return A string representation of the Task.
* Generates a string that can be stored for import upon program start.
* @return A simplified string representation of the task.
* TaskList class for CS2103T iP. Wrapper class for a LinkedList while also routing messages
* to a Ui object for printing.
* Returns the size of the list.
* @param index Index of task of interest.
* Deletes task at specified index and prints relevant messages.
output[2] = "Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Lists all tasks in the list.
output[0] = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
output[0] = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:";
* Verbose method for adding task to list.
output[0] = "Got it. I've added this task:";
output[2] = "Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Used for importing saved tasks, no messages required.
* Ui class for CS2103T iP. Handles printing of messages from the program.
* Prints supplied message within the 2 lines.
* Overloaded method for multiple line messages.
* @param texts Multi line message stored in a String array.
* Prints the welcome logo and text.
System.out.println("     Hello! I'm Duke\n     What can I do for you?");
System.out.println(INDENTATION + "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints when there is an IOException.
System.out.println("â˜¹ OOPS!!! An uncorrectable error occurred");
private final TaskList list = new TaskList(new Ui());
private final Task testTask = new Task(" test task", 0);
private final Task task1 = new Task(" test todo", 0);
private final Task task2 = new Task(" test deadline with date /by 2020-01-01", 1);
private final Task task3 = new Task(" test event with time /at 14:25", 2);
assertEquals("[D][X] test deadline with date (by: Jan 1 2020)", task2.toString());
assertEquals("2 0 test event with time /at 14:25", task3.export());
